<!-- Copilot instructions for this repository. Keep concise and actionable. -->
# Copilot / AI agent instructions — My Landing (Angular)

Goal: help contributors modify and extend this Angular (v16) personal landing site with minimal context switching.

- **Project root:** `angular.json`, `package.json`, `src/`
- **Primary app code:** `src/app/` (component-per-folder pattern). Example components: `src/app/myprofile`, `src/app/header`, `src/app/habilidades`.

Key workflows
- **Run dev server:** `npm start` (runs `ng serve`, default dev at `http://localhost:4200/`). Use PowerShell on Windows.
- **Build for production:** `npm run build` (runs `ng build` — outputs to `dist/my-landing`).
- **Run unit tests:** `npm test` (Karma/Jasmine). There is no e2e setup by default.

Architecture & conventions
- This is a small single-page Angular application generated by Angular CLI v16. The app uses the classic module + component approach. The root module is `src/app/app.module.ts` and routing is defined in `src/app/app-routing.module.ts`.
- Components are organized as isolated folders under `src/app/`. Each folder contains `*.component.ts`, `*.component.html`, `*.component.css` and `*.component.spec.ts`.
- Global styles live in `src/styles.css`. Per-component styles use the component CSS files.
- Assets (images, icons) live in `src/assets/` and are referenced from templates.

Routing & bootstrapping notes
- The app's default route is registered in `src/app/app-routing.module.ts` and currently maps `""` to `MyprofileComponent`.
- `AppModule` imports `AppRoutingModule` but also imports `RouterModule.forRoot([])` directly. Prefer changes to routes via `app-routing.module.ts` to keep routing centralized.

Patterns and code examples
- Scrolling and responsive behavior: `src/app/app.component.ts` implements `@HostListener('window:scroll')` and `@HostListener('window:resize')` to toggle `showTopHeader`, `layoutConSidebar`, `isMobile`. Keep changes to thresholds (768/1024) consistent with existing UX.
- When adding a new UI section, follow the existing component-per-folder pattern and register the component in `AppModule` (or lazy-load via a module if size/complexity increases).
- Prefix for generated selectors is `app` (defined in `angular.json` -> `prefix`). Use `ng generate component <name>` to scaffold.

Dependency & build specifics
- Angular CLI/tooling versions are specified in `package.json`. Typescript ~5.1, Angular 16.2.x, `@angular/cli` ~16.2.16.
- `angular.json` defines a `development` build configuration with `sourceMap: true` and a `production` configuration with `outputHashing: all`.

Testing & quality
- Unit tests use Karma + Jasmine. Tests live next to components as `*.component.spec.ts` files. Run `npm test` to execute.
- There are no linting or formatting tools configured in the repo; do not add formatting assumptions unless requested.

What to avoid
- Do not modify `index.html` or `main.ts` unless you have to—these bootstrapping files follow Angular CLI defaults.
- Avoid adding global CSS rules that break component encapsulation; prefer per-component styles unless you need app-wide theming.

Where to change common behavior
- To change header/sidebar scroll behavior: edit `src/app/app.component.ts` and aligned templates `src/app/app.component.html`.
- To add routes: modify `src/app/app-routing.module.ts` and then update `AppModule` imports if adding lazy-loaded modules.

If uncertain, useful files to open
- `package.json` (scripts & deps)
- `angular.json` (build/serve/test configurations)
- `src/app/app.module.ts` (module wiring)
- `src/app/app-routing.module.ts` (routes)
- Any `src/app/*/*.component.ts` for UI and interaction patterns

Ask the user if you need:
- preferred git branch workflow or commit conventions
- intended audience for new features (affects perf/size trade-offs)
- whether adding lint, formatting, or CI is acceptable

End of instructions.
